column3: like homestar runner and one i‚Äôll show later
column4: though) guess what? this is flash! this is also flash! THIS is puppet animation: the funniest part is that most puppet animation isn‚Äôt even done in flash anymore. people use after effects instead because it has MUCH more sophisticated and useful tools meant specifically for puppet animation. the technique can be used well
column5: however. my little pony does it so fluidly it looks practically seamless. homestar runner doesn‚Äôt focus nearly as much on fluidity
column7: expressive key poses and making every frame really count. puppet animation isn‚Äôt even limited to digital mediums. in fact
column8: it‚Äôs not new at all. the adventures of prince achmed is the world‚Äôs oldest surviving feature-length animated film - that‚Äôs right
column9: predating snow white by over 10 years - and it was done entirely using puppet animation; black paper cutouts atop illuminated backgrounds. and it‚Äôs truly fucking breathtaking.  Things I believe needed to be said. It‚Äôs not the technique or the tool
column10: it‚Äôs¬†what¬†the artist does with it.¬† " False text
